  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33465].
  {panel}

If you are viewing a page that has an image which is attached to some other page it is not clear where the image is actually from.

The only way to tell now is to Edit the page and then hover over the image and view the tooltip, see attached image.

It would be nicer if this information were presented somewhere less transient. Note that the Page Information page does list the pages under "Outgoing Links" but that does not tell you which images map to which pages.

The Image Properties might be a good place to put the information. After all where the image is located is a property of the image.
fields.summary: Improve attachment information for images, currently in tooltip

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33463].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in Team Calendars you cannot add an attachment or link to an attachment to download, except maybe in the Description field.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to either upload an attachment, or link to it within the event.

h3. Why this is important
 It would be really helpful to be able to link to an attachment in a Team Calendar event. Through Related Page, you can currently link to a page or put in a url for an external webpage. Can you please make it so you can link to an attachment here the same way you would a page (through search)? Thank you!
fields.summary: link to an attachment from a team calendar event

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce the bug:

1. Create a page containing a mention to a user.
2. Select some text containing the mention link and click the balloon icon to quote the text in a comment.
3. Save the comment (quoted_mention_comment.png).

Result:

The link in the quoted mention link does not work as expected and returns a warning for an "undefined" user (quoted_mention_result).

As a matter of fact, the markup of the quoted mention link merely looks like a mention, but it does not contain all the required attributes for it to work (see quoted_mention_link.png and mention_link.png).

Expected result:

Make sure that the quoted mention works or remove the mention link/formatting when quoted.
fields.summary: User mentions not working when quoted in comments

fields.description:
h5.Summary
After renaming a user in Active Directory, and performing a sync in Crowd/JIRA, Crowd/JIRA correctly identifies that the user is an updated user, rather than a whole new user. When syncing from that same Crowd/JIRA to Confluence, Confluence incorrectly identifies the user as a new user, and will create a user account for them.

h5.Environment
Crowd/JIRA has a connector to Active Directory. The base DN is set at an OU that has only one user. This user is Joe Smith, and has the username jsmith. Confluence is in turn connected to this Crowd/JIRA Server

h5.Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a user in Active Directory, jsmith.
# Sync Crowd/JIRA. Verify the user appears in Crowd/JIRA.
# Sync Confluence with Crowd/JIRA. Verify the user appears in Confluence.
# On the user in Active Directory: Right Click » Properties » Account » Adjust both logon names to smithj
# Sync Crowd/JIRA. Verify the username is updated correctly in Crowd/JIRA.
# Sync Confluence. Verify that there is now a user for jsmith, and smithj.

(!) *Note*: This problem only affects Confluence when you synchronise from Active Directory into Crowd/JIRA. It does not affect Confluence connecting to AD directly

h5.Other Information.

When I created the user originally and synced into Crowd, I found the following information:

{noformat}
GUID: f877e918-fd42-46ce-89be-88ecadf2d1a0}
SID: S-1-5-21-348418773-4108394185-1306204109-366320
External ID in Conf: 819201:18e977f842fdce4689be88ecadf2d1a0
External ID in Crowd: 18e977f842fdce4689be88ecadf2d1a0
{noformat}

After Confluence sync'd the user incorrectly, there were two entries in {{cwd_user}} with an external ID of 819201:18e977f842fdce4689be88ecadf2d1a0 - the only difference was the user name.

h5.Verification information:
* Before Rename.ldif - LDIF of the user before it was renamed in Active Directory
* After Rename.ldif - LDIF of the user after it was renamed in Active Directory
* DirectoryConfigSummaryCrowd.txt: Crowd's Directory Configuration Summary, showing the connector for Active Directory and applications
* DirectoryConfigSummaryConfluence.txt: Confluence's Directory Configuration Summary, showing both a Direct Connection to AD, and a Connection to Crowd
* cwd_user.Confluence.Before.csv: Output of {{SELECT * FROM CWD_USER}} in Confluence before the rename. There are two records for {{dnorton}} in the table
* cwd_user.Confluence.After.csv: Output of same query in Confluence after the rename - there are two {{dave.norton}} entries for each directory, as well as the incorrect {{dnorton}} - note they only appear in the Crowd Directory, not the Direct AD one.
* cwd_user.Crowd.Before.csv: Output of {{select * from cwd_user where directory_id != 32769;}} in Crowd showing a single {{dnorton}} before rename
* cwd_user.Crowd.After.csv: Output of same query in Crowd showing a single record - renamed to {{dave.norton}}.

h5.Workaround
* Create a new user directory with the same configuration as the original
** Ensure successful sync
* Disable the original user directory, move new directory to be primary
* Ensure new directory is working before removing original.
fields.summary: After renaming a user in Active Directory, Confluence syncs that user in as a new user (if and only if Confluence is connected to JIRA or Crowd, which is in turn connected to LDAP)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

This was cloned from JRA-33704 which had the same issues. The remedy is to change the URL:

http://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/docs-55/whatsnew/iframe

To be:

It should be:

https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/docs-55/whatsnew/iframe

----


h3. Steps to reproduce
# Setup JIRA with Apache proxy and SSL
# Access JIRA with one new user which has never login before (via IE10 or Google Chrome internet browser)
# The What's New Content (JIRA Welcome page) will show something like below:
!1.jpg!

h3. According to customer analysing:
This seems to be an issue with the linked iframe content that is redirected to content that is http. Since it redirects from https to http back to https, the internet browser wont show it as http is considered unsecure Iframe content.
Please refer to the following screenshots: [^screenshot-1.jpg] and [^screenshot-2.jpg]
fields.summary: what's new content(Confluence Welcome page) not working if Confluence is running behind proxy and configured with SSL

fields.description:
Changing the permissions of a page causes the edge index to fall into an inconsistent state.

* Pages with restrictions will be removed from the edge index completely. These pages will not be re-added to edge index again, even if they are completely unrestricted again.
* Children of pages with restrictions will not be given permissionSet fields correctly, which results in them showing up in the Popular dashboard tab for users that do not have permission to view them.
fields.summary: Edge-index incorrect behaviour when content permissions change

fields.description:
An incompatibility has been introduced with this build. When running search when > 50 elements found. Limiting the count parameter to 50 or less works around this problem. However, existing automation will fail as it is not common to impose a result limit. Moreover, it is important to be able to find ALL elements matching the search criteria so that automation can act on each result. If you want to enforce paging support, then that should be done via REST APIs only or make the new SOAP limit much higher and some way to do the paging.

# While in edit mode click to add a title.

# Now hit "CTRL+S", instead of saving the Confluence page you will get the browser window to save the page as a htm file:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33425].
  {panel}

As a Confluence administrator I would like to easily search through my user database based on a number of factors. Some of these could include:
* Last login date (e.g., show me all users who haven't logged in in 180 days).
* People who are a member of one group but not another (e.g., who is in "QA" but not "UK-QA").
* List all users who can access a specified space (i.e., by virtue of being a member of a certain group which has permission).

Ideally I'd like some sort of way running a query string against the user database. I used to be able to do this using a user macro but since my user base has grown to nearly 2000 users, the operation times out before completion (in any case, a search like this was very inefficient, often taking minutes).

Finally, if possible, I'd then like the ability to perform bulk operations on the results but that's probably a whole different request.
fields.summary: Enable Administrators to Query User Database

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33424].
  {panel}

I am using Confluence-Jaxb version 2.1 (http://confluence.highsource.org/display/HJ3/JAXB) to generate Java beans for the XSD below. Java source code is properly generated but JAXB is not able to successfully unmarshal a valid XML file conforming to the XSD. I have provided below the XSD, my conformant XML file, and my Java code used to unmarshal.

My specific problem is as below. I am using a custom Java class named com.tree.JAXBLeafNode for the element LeafNode in the XSD and have provided corresponding JaxB annotations to NOT generate Java beans for this element. I have also provided a custom XmlAdapter to marshal/unmarshal the element LeafNode. My custom marshal/unmarshaling handles converting the XML attributes appearing in the element LeafNode into some custom Java objects. LeafNode's parent element RootOrInnerNode, however, has the standard confluence-JAXB generated - Java beans. It has a List<JAXBElement<?>> to hold the contained LeafNode elements. It should be noted that, in the XSD, LeafNode's parent element RootOrInnerNode only contains the element AbstractNode as a direct child element and not the element LeafNode itself. LeafNode is rather indirectly rendered as a child of RootOrInnerNode since it is a substitution group for the element AbstractNode. Upon inspection using eclipse's debugger, I discovered that the List<JAXBElement<?>> in RootOrInnerNode contains a  null for the LeafNodes. It appears that my custom XMLAdapter for the element LeafNode is not called, while instantiating its parent element RootOrInnerNode's JAXB bean and hence, the List<JAXBElement<?>> is not populated with the corresponding LeafNodes

I have these constraints upon the XSD and custom Java bean,Adapter and marshal/unmarshall methods, while fixing this error. 1) I cannot change the schema. AbstractNode must exist the way it is in the XSD and both the RootOrInnerNode and LeafNode should have the existing associations with AbstractNode. This is the case since changing the XSD triggers lot bigger changes in several other parts of the project. 2) I must use custom Java beans named com.tree.JAXBLeafNode for the element LeafNode and a custom XMLAdapter since, I expect the binary data anyAttribute namespace=="##any" in the LeafNode element and do a lot of custom processing of this data.

Would be of great help if I can obtain a way to generate the right LeafNode objects into the List<JAXBElement<?>> in RootOrInnerNode.
fields.summary: Does not parse List<JaxbElement<?>> with a child element using custom XMLAdapter

fields.description:
Hello,

We just upgrade Confluence version from 5.3 to 5.4.4 in order to fix security alert and obtain new functionalities (JIRA Links info banner).

When I link Confluence page from Jira issue (More actions>Link>Confluence Page>Search article) I don't see info banner in Confluence to tell me that this Confluence page is mentionned in JIRA issue.

I don't know if there is a issue with thin plugin or non compatibilities with JIRA versions (v 5.1.8).

Can you help me?

Thanks

Cedric
fields.summary: Confluence JIRA Links - No info banner that displays JIRA content linked to the page.

fields.description:
After upgrading to Confluence 5.4.4 we discovered that the blog-posts macro is now taking a very long time to render. In the first reports it was passing 120 seconds and the renderer was timing out. For smaller cases it still took 20 seconds, 40 seconds, or 60 seconds.

In the case of around 20 seconds... it was only matching 7 blog posts generating a 7 row table! We think this is not reasonable, especially since we rely on blog-posts to list the titles of 30 or more blog posts in some places, and these are taking 60 seconds or timing out at 120 seconds.

We use blog posts for many purposes. One of these purposes is meeting minutes. Meeting minutes can get reasonably long (3 or more pages) and meeting minutes can include many references to the JIRA issue macro. In this case, I believe the JIRA issue macro in Confluence 5.4.4 has become very slow to render and this has made the problem with blog-posts much more severe as a result.

After significant analysis, I believe the problem is as follows:

1) The blog-posts macro first searches for all matching blogs. (FAST)
2) The blog-posts macro then renders each matching blog. (VERY SLOW)
3) The blog-posts macro then passes this rendered content into the velocity macro for output. (FAST)

In this case, we only want titles. So, why is the blog-posts macro fully rendering every single matching blog content just to display the blog title?

I created this patch to the Confluence Advanced Macros Plugin:

{noformat}
diff --git a/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/macros/advanced/BlogPostsMacro.java b/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/macros/advanced/BlogPos
index 91a77d1..fddcd3e 100644
--- a/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/macros/advanced/BlogPostsMacro.java
+++ b/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/macros/advanced/BlogPostsMacro.java
@@ -519,6 +519,13 @@ public class BlogPostsMacro extends ContentFilteringMacro implements Macro
      */
     private String getContent(BlogPost post, String contentType)
     {
+        if (CONTENT_TITLES.equals(contentType) || CONTENT_TITLES_ALIAS.equals(contentType))
+        {
+            // Caller wants the title only. No need to return any content.
+            return "";
+        }
+
+
         String excerpt;
         if (CONTENT_EXCERPTS.equals(contentType))
         {
{noformat}

Before deploying this change, I could see side by side that both production and test environments were very slow. For my chosen test case, it was taking between 20 and 30 seconds to display just 7 blog post titles. This was every time on reload.

After deploying this change to our test environment... the test environment now completes in about 2 seconds for the same 7 blog post titles.

I will chase down the "why" of "why are the blog posts' content being rendered so slow" as a separate issue. For now, please accept that some pages do render more slowly than other pages, and I think it is important that Atlassian patches blog-posts to not render the entire blog post content, when only the blog post titles are necessary as this will significantly cut down on the processing power required for this macro in a very common use case.

If we ask for the blog post content, and each blog post content takes a while to render, then this is reasonable. If we ask for the blog post title, and each blog post content takes a while to render, this is not reasonable.

I think this is a simple fix for you and because Confluence 5.4.4 has regressed in a major way for a primary function (at least for us), I would like this fix to be considered critical.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Confluence blog-posts macro renders entire blog body even when only the title is required

To have a feel:

# In the sidebar, click *Atlassian OnDemand > Administering Atlassian OnDemand > Defining a project*.

fields.description:
When trying to debug other issues, we found that Workbox was inexplicably sitting on 28Meg of memory.

From the attached screen shot you can see that the DefaultReliabilityService is hanging onto a full 10,000 item queue of tasks.  This seems to imply that something is fully broken one way or another, either the queue is too small (unlikley) and so needs dynamic sizing of some sort or stuff is hanging around in the queue far too long (most likely).

This could also be a hog in OD
fields.summary: Workbox consumes excessive globs of memory on JAC
REST API Content Body map has badly-formed values

fields.description:
A Confluence space that is open to anonymous access, with anonymous users able to add comments or add/edit pages, will throw a NullPointerException during the quick reload operation. 

Functionally, this means that for logged in users, they will not see the reload prompt if comments or edits are made anonymously. The page will have to be reloaded in order to see any changes made anonymously.

fields.description:
To reproduce, create a space "TestBug" in Confluence, then do the following on the space permissions:
# Strip out all Anonymous access from TestBug
# Remove the jira-administrators group from group permissions (note we are using integrated access from JIRA)
# Add in admin-user1 to the individual users section
# Login as admin-user2
# Confirm that admin-user2 is unable to see TestBug space in list of spaces
# Go to Confluence Admin -> Space Permissions
# Press the "Recover Permissions" button for TestBug
# It should change to "Manage Permissions"; try to click that link
# You should get to an error page saying Not Permitted

Now, back as admin-user1, you can validate that admin-user2 got added to the individual users section as an Admin, but has no View access, so cannot see the admin page.

This is bad news if you dont have a fellow admin to help you unlock yourself or regain access.
fields.summary: "Recover Permissions" does not work on a site if jira-administrators group not set

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33406].
  {panel}

I would like to be able to print a hardcopy of an entire wiki, or even better select different pages/"chapters" of a wiki.  This feature is in Wikipedia and is so useful for building "books" of knowledge on a specific topic.

I've looked through the documentation for our version of Atlassian Confluence (2.8.0) and have not found this feature.

I'm able to print pages separately, but creating a .pdf of entire wiki would be very, very useful for giving to customers (who can't access our internal servers) or just for archiving a hard copy.

A logical place to add this might be in the "tree view" portion of the administration page.
fields.summary: add ability to print a hardcopy of an entire wiki
Restore the tempate prompt when creating a new page from a red link

fields.description:
The navigation links at the bottom of the people directory are broken because they use & in the URL instead of ? to specify the startIndex parameter.

Clicking on the "People" link in our Confluence install leads to
{noformat}http://confluence.axiomainc.com/confluence/browsepeople.action?startIndex=0{noformat}

Then clicking on the "2" or next button at the bottom goes to
{noformat}http://confluence.axiomainc.com/confluence/browsepeople.action&startIndex=50{noformat}
which fails with "page not found".

Our current production instance uses 5.3.1. I upgraded our staging instance to 5.4.4 but the bug is still present.
fields.summary: Navigation links in People Directory are broken

fields.description:
If you put curly braces (e.g. "{}") in macro string parameters, the macro is likely to break in the WYSIWYG editor, but it will work on the final page. If you escape the curly braces like {noformat}\{{noformat} it will work in WYSIWYG, but show a wrong result on the real page

*What will break?*
* If it's a macro with macro body, the preview will lose it's icon and it's description text (name and selected parameters).
* If it's a macro without a body, the preview gets stuck loading with all controls like "save" or "preview" disabled.

*How to reproduce*
# Edit a page with WYSIWYG Editor
# Add a macro (panel macro for "macro with body" or gallery macro for "macro without body")
# Edit the added macro in Macro Browser
# Enter some text with curly braces into a string property field
#* e.g. use the text {{test{}} - opening curly brackets are more likely to break everything
#* for the panel macro you can add the text to the param "title"
#* for the gallery macro you can add the text to the param "title", too
# Hit the Macro Browser's save button.
# Look at the macro in the WYSIWYG Editor
#* the panel macro won't have an icon or text anymore, the bar at the top will be blank
#* the gallery macro got stuck loading, blocking the "save" and "cancel" controls
fields.summary: Curly braces can break macros in WYSIWYG Editor
Search Result to include Author Name

I use the "Create Page Macro" plugin to generate a new page. The template used is the one described above. 

Expected result: The created page uses the label applied to the template.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33391].
  {panel}

I'm a PM responsible for introducing Confluence to 900 users on a pilot basis, with the potential to extend this to ~30,000 users.  

My organisation's senior management write blog posts, and these are editable by all other users.  There is no way to "restrict editing" like we can with other content.  It should be possible to prevent unauthorised changes to blogs - I'm unable to extend the pilot any further without this facility being available.

The user story would be: "As a VIP user, I want to limit who can modify my posts, so that I can preserve the integrity of my content".

I envisage this being done through the "restrictions" tab, or through an "edit own" / "edit all" permission in the usergroup permissions.
fields.summary: Users are able to modify blogs written by other people

fields.description:
While moving a number of pages from one space to another, I was alarmed to see that the left sidebar did not show any of the moved pages while viewing the target space. However, clicking on a "recently modified" link to one of the pages caused that page to appear along with the expected page list. Clicking once again on the hyperlink for the space at the top-left of the sidebar showed no pages.

I thought it might be an indexing problem and re-indexed. Same issue.

Clearly this is a bug.
fields.summary: Moving pages from one space to another does not update the page list

Confluence should have a "last viewed date" property for pages.

fields.description:
Assign a user a task on a page to which they only have view permission for. 

That user will see the task assigned to them in the my tasks page. That is good. However, they should not be able to check the task - or they should at least get an appropriate error message about not being able to edit the page (hence not being able to check the task). Currently it just shows an ugly misleading error message when checked.

Ideally you would have a disabled checkbox instead and a tooltip explaining that you don't have edit permission but do have view permission. But then this bug occurs for the actual view page too.
fields.summary: My tasks page shows tasks the user can view but not edit causing an error when checking the task

fields.description:
Scenario/How to Reproduce:
1) Your Home Directory in the production instance is set as /var/confluence.
2) Then you copy this confluence to a testing instance.
3) In your test instance, you change the home directory to /var/confluence54
4) Confluence runs well, but the backups are still being written on /var/confluence/backups instead of recognising the new home folder and writing the backups on /var/confluence54/backups.

Workaround:
1) Enable  admin.ui.allow.manual.backup.download to 'true' on confluence.cfg.xml.
2) Restart Confluence
3) Go to Backup Administration so you'll be able to edit the default path of the backups. 
4) You'll see that the default is set as the Home Directory from the production instance, and not the current home folder.
5) So click in Custom and then Default, so then confluence will realized that the home directory is not /var/confluence anymore.
fields.summary: Backups don't archive to correct Confluence Home Directory

fields.description:
h6. Steps to Replicate

# Install Confluence using the installer version
# Proceed with the installation wizard and choose "Express Install" when ask
# After Selecting Destination Directory click Next
# After Selecting Start Menu Folder click Next
# *After Configuring TCP Ports click Next. ( Change the Control Port Number)*
# After reading Installation Summary Ccick Install
# Click Finish After installation is ready.

h6. Observed Behaviour
When you open Server.xml, you will see the server port number is still set to default.

h6. Expected Behaviour
The Server Port(server.xml) should show the control port number that have been configured in Configuring TCP Ports.
fields.summary: Control Port Number Never Changes in server.xml When Installing Confluence with Installer.

The multiple home dirs is not a new problem in Confluence, however this time it seems to be blocking the startup. Comment out all the confluence.home entries, leaving only 1 entry uncommented

fields.description:
I recently had the following scenario:
User A is confluence-administrator and creator of a page called "XY".
User B is confluence-user.
User A sets a page restriction to XY so that only he can edit the page.
User A creates an inline task and mentions User B.

If User B wants to mark the task as done on the page itself he gets an error-message.

If User B wants to mark the task as done in his workbox it disappears from there, which is not the expected behavior. The state of the task does not change on the page.
fields.summary: Inline task disappears from workbox when editing of page is restricted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33357].
  {panel}

There are times that pages stay in draft mode after publishing. When the page is stuck it also doesn't allow you to discard your draft. The only solution we've found is that someone else goes into the page, makes a change, and then publishes it himself.

The following error message appears for some users as well:
---
NOTE: This email contains information submitted to you by a user via the Confluence 'Contact Administrators' mechanism.

System Error
A system error has occurred — our apologies!
For immediate troubleshooting, consult our knowledge base for a solution.
If you would like to receive support from Atlassian's support team, ask your Confluence administrator to create a support issue on Atlassian's support system with the following information:
a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
a copy of the error and system information found below
a copy of the application logs (if possible).
Your Confluence administrator can use the support request form to create a support ticket which will include this information.
We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!
Return to site homepage…
Cause
java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.zenfoundation.drafts.ZenDraftHandler.createDraft(ZenDraftHandler.java:88)
Stack Trace:[hide]

        at com.zenfoundation.drafts.ZenDraftHandler.createDraft(ZenDraftHandler.java:73)
---

fields.description:
Set up Confluence 5.5-rc1 cluster.

Execute the following macro:

{code}
public class TestMacro extends NoBodyMacro {

    private final Cache<String, String> cache;

    public TestMacro(CacheManager cacheManager) {
        cache = cacheManager.getCache("just.a.test.cache", new TestCacheLoader());
    }

    public synchronized String execute(Map parameters, String body, ConversionContext conversionContext) throws MacroExecutionException {
        cache.putIfAbsent("bob", "something");
        cache.get("bob");
        return "";
    }

    private class TestCacheLoader implements CacheLoader<String, String> {
        @Override
        public String load(@NotNull String aKey) {
            return "some value";
        }
    }
}
{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33346].
  {panel}

We found this bug by having the following problem:

We couldn't mention an *specific* user (doris.doppelbauer) within Confluence by using @user while creating or editing a page.

We found a Explanation (see link at the end), which isn't working in our case, because the user appears in the people directory *four times", while the link to the Profile itself is always the same. The search for this user won't give aus any results.

I checked the rights and roles and in my opinion everything is alright. The user is able to watch the spaces but nobody can mention this user.

I made some screenhots in order to make you able to see the problem. 
If you have any further questions, please go ahead and ask me. Please fix this issue as soon as possible, as we need to mention users for our workflow.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/Existing+Users+do+not+Appear+in+Confluence+People+Directory,+Team+Calendars,+Share+Feature+and+Watchers+List
fields.summary: Confluence onDemand: User Multiple in Peoples Directory - not able to mention User on an Page

fields.description:
I attached [^Confluence_Test.xlsx] to a page and used the viewfile macro to display it. The result was [^Confluence_Test_Screenshot.png].

I expected a '3' in cell A1 since that is the computed value shown in Excel.
fields.summary: Viewfile macro displays wrong result for formula in xlsx file
